snippet: Psychologists suggest that procrastination, if structured, can have some benefits, by getting you to complete some tasks, even if only to avoid the ones you’re meant to be doing.
abstract: Psychologists suggest that procrastination, if structured, can benefit procrastinators by making them complete some tasks, even if only to avoid the ones they are meant to be doing.
lead_paragraph: Psychologists suggest that procrastination, if structured, can have some benefits, by getting you to complete some tasks, even if only to avoid the ones you’re meant to be doing.

headline.main: This Was Supposed to Be My Column for New Year’s Day
headline.print_headline: This Was Supposed to Be My Column for New Year’s Day
